titleStmt.title: Ireland. By the Commissioners of the Common-wealth of England for the Affairs of Ireland. Whereas several persons being sued for just debts have been, and are dayly taken in execution, and to avoid the payment of their said debts out of their estates, do continue in prison, and enjoy the benefit of their estates, which oftentimes are by them consumed in gaols, ale-houses, and other places amongst their lewd and wicked companions ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Commissioners of the Common-wealth of England for the Affairs of Ireland.

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Reproduction of original in: Library Company of Philadelphia.
